firstPerformanceYear:
metricType (required)



possible values:



boolean, proportion, singlePerformanceRate, multiPerformanceRate, registrySinglePerformanceRate, registryMultiPerformanceRate, nonProportion, cahps



for definitions: review https://cmsgov.github.io/qpp-submissions-docs/measurements
lastPerformanceYear:
firstPerformanceYear (required)



Year in which the measure was introduced



The API  will default to 2017 if this column is left blank
eMeasureUuid:
lastPerformanceYear (required)



Year in which the measure was deprecated.



The API will default to null if this column is left blank
isHighPriority:
eMeasureUuid (optional)



UUID for Electronic Clinical Quality Measures (ECQM)
isInverse:
isHighPriority (required)



If true, can be used in the place of an outcome measure to satisfy quality category requirements.



Possible values: true, false
numStrataClaims:
isInverse (required)



If true, a lower performance rate correlates with better performance.



Possible values: true, false
numStrataRegistry:
# of performance rate strata (required) Claims



must be 1 or more
numStrataEcqm:
# of performance rate strata (required) Registry



must be 1 or more
overallAlgorithm:
# of performance rate strata (required) eCQM



must be 1 or more
default:
overallAlgorithm (required if there is more than one performance rate stratum)



Formula to determine the overall performance rate, given multiple strata of performance rates. Only applicable to multiPerformanceRate measures.



Possible values: simpleAverage, weightedAverage, sumNumerators, overallStratumOnly

title: Diabetes: Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) Poor Control (>9%)
description: Percentage of patients 18-75 years of age with diabetes who had hemoglobin A1c > 9.0% during the measurement period

title: Coronary Artery Disease (CAD): Beta-Blocker Therapy - Prior Myocardial Infarction (MI) or Left Ventricular Systolic Dysfunction (LVEF < 40%)
description: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older with a diagnosis of coronary artery disease seen within a 12-month period who also have a prior MI OR a current or prior LVEF <40% who were prescribed beta-blocker therapy

title: Medication Reconciliation Post-Discharge
description:
The percentage of discharges from any inpatient facility (e.g. hospital, skilled nursing facility, or rehabilitation facility) for patients 18 years and older of age seen within 30 days following discharge in the office by the physician, prescribing practitioner, registered nurse, or clinical pharmacist providing on-going care for whom the discharge medication list was reconciled with the current medication list in the outpatient medical record.

This measure is reported as three rates stratified by age group: Submission Criteria 1: 18-64 years of age; Submission Criteria 2: 65 years and older; Total Rate: All patients 18 years of age and older
